newsitem.title: UK: UK shares end mixed, interest rate worries weigh.
newsitem.headline: UK shares end mixed, interest rate worries weigh.

text.p: UK shares ended a choppy session mixed amid continued uncertainty about possible interest rate hikes.
Fears that rates could be tightened by both U.S. and UK central banks in the near-term kept many participants out of the market and capped an promising FTSE rally, dealers said.
"In the short-term the FTSE looks like it still has room to move higher but there is just to much for the market to worry about, including interest rates," one senior dealer said.
The FTSE 100 closed 0.7 of a point lower to 4,557.1, well below an earlier intraday peak of 4,585.9.
